cards.name: Deep Spawn
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Deep Spawn unless you put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
{U}: Deep Spawn gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Deep Spawn. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Deep Spawn unless you put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
{U}: Deep Spawn gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Deep Spawn.

cards.name: Dreams of the Dead
cards.text: {1}{U}: Return target white or black creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains "Cumulative upkeep {2}." If the creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else. (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless they pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

rulings.text: This is a replacement effect.

If a creature returned to the battlefield with Dreams of the Dead would leave the battlefield for any reason, it's exiled instead — unless the spell or ability that's causing the creature to leave the battlefield is actually trying to exile it! In that case, it succeeds at exiling it. If it later returns the creature card to the battlefield (as Oblivion Ring or Flickerwisp might, for example), the creature card will return to the battlefield as a new object with no relation to its previous existence.

If a permanent has multiple instances of cumulative upkeep, each triggers separately. However, the age counters are not connected to any particular ability; each cumulative upkeep ability will count the total number of age counters on the permanent at the time that ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {1}{U}: Return target white or black creature card from your graveyard to play. That creature gains "Cumulative upkeep {2}." If the creature would leave play, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Enervate
cards.text:
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage
cards.originalText:
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Essence Flare
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.
cards.flavor: Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.

rulings.text: The -0/-1 counters stay on the creature even if Essence Flare is removed.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.

cards.name: Iceberg
cards.text:
Iceberg enters the battlefield with X ice counters on it.
{3}: Put an ice counter on Iceberg.
Remove an ice counter from Iceberg: Add {C}.
cards.originalText:
Iceberg comes into play with X ice counters on it.
{3}: Put an ice counter on Iceberg.
Remove an ice counter from Iceberg: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Icy Prison
cards.text:
When Icy Prison enters the battlefield, exile target creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Icy Prison unless any player pays {3}.
When Icy Prison leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: If Icy Prison leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its third ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted creature forever.

cards.originalText:
When Icy Prison comes into play, remove target creature from the game.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Icy Prison unless any player pays {3}.
When Icy Prison leaves play, return the removed creature to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Krovikan Sorcerer
cards.text:
{T}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.
cards.flavor:
"These sorcerers always seem to have another surprise up their sleeves."
—Zur the Enchanter
cards.originalText:
{T}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.

cards.name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
cards.text: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"All the knowledge of Lat-Nam could not protect its sages from the Brothers' War."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

rulings.text: Shuffling a card from your hand into your library is mandatory. The effect says "if you do" because performing that action might have been impossible. If you fail to shuffle a card into your library because your hand was empty, you won't draw any cards.

cards.originalText: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Magus of the Unseen
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Untap target artifact an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the artifact, tap it.

rulings.text: You may target an untapped artifact with this ability.
The artifact taps after returning to the opponent (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You tap the artifact when you lose control of it for any reason — because Magus of the Unseen's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.
The artifact will gain haste whether or not it's a creature. Of course, if it's not a creature, haste will have no particular effect.

cards.originalText: {1}{U}, {T}: Untap target artifact an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the artifact, tap it.

cards.name: Marjhan
cards.text:
Marjhan doesn't untap during your untap step.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Untap Marjhan. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Marjhan can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}{U}: Marjhan gets -1/-0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to target attacking creature without flying.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Marjhan.

rulings.text: The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Marjhan doesn't untap during your untap step.
Marjhan can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Marjhan.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Untap Marjhan. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
{U}{U}: Marjhan gets -1/-0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to target attacking creature without flying.

cards.name: Mesmeric Trance
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Magic overused can freeze the mind. Creativity is more important than power."
—Zur the Enchanter
cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {1}
{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

cards.name: Musician
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Put a music counter on target creature. If it doesn't have "At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy this creature unless you pay {1} for each music counter on it," it gains that ability.

rulings.text: Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

This ability has no duration. An affected creature will retain the triggered ability until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect causes it to lose its abilities. It doesn't matter if Musician is still on the battlefield or not.
Although a creature can gain the triggered ability only once, it can be targeted by multiple Musicians to increase its number of music counters.

If a music counter is put on a creature by some other means (Fate Transfer, for example), but that creature has never been affected by Musician's ability, that creature won't have the triggered ability and its controller won't have to pay mana. The music counters will stay on that creature but won't do anything.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {1}
{T}: Put a music counter on target creature. If it doesn't have "At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy this creature unless you pay {1} for each music counter on it," it gains that ability.

cards.name: Narwhal
cards.text: First strike, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"Who needs a spear? Ya break off the horn, and ya stab the fish with it. Easy!"
—Kakra, sea troll
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from red

cards.name: Personal Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

cards.name: Phantasmal Mount
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature you control with toughness 2 or less gets +1/+1 and gains flying until end of turn. When Phantasmal Mount leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice that creature. When the creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Phantasmal Mount.

rulings.text: If the ability resolves, then the targeted creature's toughness becomes greater than 2 later, Phantasmal Mount's effect will not end. (The ability checks whether the creature has toughness 2 or less only at the time you activate it and the time it resolves.)

cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target creature you control with toughness 2 or less gets +1/+1 and gains flying until end of turn. When Phantasmal Mount leaves play this turn, sacrifice that creature. When the creature leaves play this turn, sacrifice Phantasmal Mount.

cards.name: Portent
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle their library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: This does not cause a player to lose if they have less than 3 cards in their library. It allows you to look at and reorder or shuffle whatever remaining cards there might be.

cards.originalText:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Ray of Command
cards.text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.

rulings.text: You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.

The creature returns to the opponent when the "until end of turn" effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason — because Ray of Command's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

cards.originalText: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.

cards.name: Red Cliffs Armada
cards.text: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than seven thousand warships on the Yangtze.
cards.originalText: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.name: Screeching Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Screeching Drake enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Screeching Drake comes into play, draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Sea Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, if one of the lands has become an illegal target (because it's no longer on the battlefield, for example), you return the other one to your hand. If both of the lands have become illegal targets, the ability doesn't resolve. This has no effect on Sea Drake.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sea Drake comes into play, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Sea Spirit
cards.text: {U}: Sea Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. No foggy, ice-laden sea in the world could frighten me more."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: {U}: Sea Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shyft
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Shyft become the color or colors of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor:
"Capturing this specimen was not easy. Study it well, that you someday might be as versatile."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

rulings.text: Shyft's ability won't let you make it colorless. Colorless is not a color.

The ability's effect has no duration. Shyft will remain the chosen color or colors until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect (such as the next time its ability resolves) changes its colors.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Shyft become the color or colors of your choice.

cards.name: Sibilant Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Relax. I'm sure it's just a snake hissing."
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald

rulings.text: Your opponent does not have to draw a card if they don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.

cards.name: Storm Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: Tap target creature with flying.
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: If the exiled card is a snow land, Storm Elemental gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Even though the two activated abilities have the same cost, they're separate. You choose which one you're activating before you exile the top card of your library (and see what it is).
If you activate Storm Elemental's third ability and the exiled card is not a snow land, the ability has no effect.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}, Remove the top card of your library from the game: Tap target creature with flying.
{U}, Remove the top card of your library from the game: If the removed card is a snow land, Storm Elemental gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Temporal Manipulation
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavor: Doing something at the last minute isn't so bad when you can make that minute last.

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Thought Lash
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep—Exile the top card of your library. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When a player doesn't pay Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep, that player exiles all cards from their library.
Exile the top card of your library: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

rulings.text: If you don't pay Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep, you'll sacrifice Thought Lash as normal, then, when its triggered ability resolves, you'll exile all cards in your library.
If your library has no cards in it, you can't activate the last ability.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep—Remove the top card of your library from the game.
When Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep isn't paid, remove your library from the game.
Remove the top card of your library from the game: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

cards.name: Thunder Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
{U}: Thunder Wall gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The lemures had barely taken wing when the sky roared with thunder. The swarm of little beasts wavered, divided, and fell, crashing to the earth."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText:
Defender, flying
{U}: Thunder Wall gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: A fallen viscerid's only tribute is to be worn by a comrade.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1. 
{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Viscerid Drone
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a Swamp: Destroy target nonartifact creature. It can't be regenerated.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a snow Swamp: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Not all of Terisiare's flooding was natural . . . .
cards.originalText:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a Swamp: Destroy target nonartifact creature. It can't be regenerated.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a snow Swamp: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Wall of Kelp
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}{U}, {T}: Create a 0/1 blue Plant Wall creature token with defender named Kelp.
cards.flavor:
"Ya can eat it or ya can weave it, but ya can't fight in it."
—Zeki, reef pirate
cards.originalText:
Defender
{U}{U}, {T}: Put a 0/1 blue Plant Wall creature token with defender named Kelp into play.

cards.name: Wind Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"To visit the sky requires bravery, and thought, and little else. To master the sky requires the binding of its masters, and little else."
—Arnjlot Olasson, sky mage
cards.originalText:
Flying
Wind Spirit can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

cards.name: Zuran Spellcaster
cards.text: {T}: Zuran Spellcaster deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"A mage must be precise as well as potent; cautious, as well as clever."
—Zur the Enchanter
cards.originalText: {T}: Zuran Spellcaster deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Armor Thrull
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor:
"The worst thing about being a mercenary for the Ebon Hand is having to wear a dead thrull."
—Ivra Jursdotter
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Ashen Ghoul
cards.text:
Haste
{B}: Return Ashen Ghoul from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if three or more creature cards are above Ashen Ghoul.

rulings.text: A card is "above" another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later.
Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.
If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.

The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it's put into its owner's graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.

Say you're the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that's attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma's Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they're put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it's put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.

cards.originalText:
Haste
{B}: Return Ashen Ghoul from your graveyard to play. Play this ability only during your upkeep and only if three or more creature cards are above Ashen Ghoul.

cards.name: Balduvian Dead
cards.text: {2}{R}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 3/1 black and red Graveborn creature token with haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the ability is activated during a turn's Ending phase (after any "at the beginning of the End step" triggers would have triggered that turn), the Graveborn token will remain on the battlefield until the following turn's End step.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}, Remove a creature card in your graveyard from the game: Put a 3/1 black and red Graveborn creature token with haste into play. Sacrifice it at end of turn.

cards.name: Brine Shaman
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
{1}{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor:
"The shamans of Marit Lage do her bidding in secret, but they do it gladly."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
{1}{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Broken Visage
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact attacking creature. It can't be regenerated. Create a black Spirit creature token. Its power is equal to that creature's power and its toughness is equal to that creature's toughness. Sacrifice the token at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: The token creature enters the battlefield under your control regardless of who controlled the targeted creature.
The Spirit token has the power and toughness of the attacking creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact attacking creature. It can't be regenerated. Put a black Spirit creature token into play with that creature's power and toughness. Sacrifice the token at end of turn.

cards.name: Cloak of Confusion
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it assign no combat damage this turn. If you do, defending player discards a card at random.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature you control
Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal no combat damage this turn. If you do, defending player discards a card at random.

cards.name: Dance of the Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Dance of the Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Dance of the Dead." Put enchanted creature card onto the battlefield tapped under your control and attach Dance of the Dead to it. When Dance of the Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {1}{B}. If the player does, untap that creature.

rulings.text: If more than one Dance of the Dead ends up on a creature, each contributes a +1/+1. But you only have to pay the untap cost once. You may pay for each one, however, and untap the card more than once during upkeep.

This is a new wording. Dance of the Dead is now an Aura. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to that card again (since the card is treated as a new object on the battlefield).

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Dance of the Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Dance of the Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Dance of the Dead to another creature won't work.

If the creature card put onto the battlefield has protection from black (or anything that prevents this from legally being attached), this won't be able to attach to it. Then this will go to the graveyard as a state-based action, causing the creature to be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Dance of the Dead comes into play, if it's in play, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put into play with Dance of the Dead." Return enchanted creature card to play tapped under your control and attach Dance of the Dead to it. When Dance of the Dead leaves play, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {1}{B}. If he or she does, untap that creature.

cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Will not the mountains quake and hills melt at the coming of the darkness? Share this vision with your enemies, Lim-Dûl, and they shall wither."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Demonic Consultation
cards.text: Choose a card name. Exile the top six cards of your library, then reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card with the chosen name. Put that card into your hand and exile all other cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: There is no way to make this card affect your opponent. It affects "you", and "you" means the controller of the spell. It has no targets.
You must name a card that actually exists in the game of Magic.
You don't name a card until Demonic Consultation resolves.

If you don't reveal the named card (perhaps because it was in the top six cards of your library), you'll end up exiling your entire library. You don't lose the game at that point, but will lose the next time you're instructed to draw a card.

cards.originalText: Name a card. Remove the top six cards of your library from the game, then reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card. Put that card into your hand and remove all other cards revealed this way from the game.

cards.name: Drift of the Dead
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Drift of the Dead's power and toughness are each equal to the number of snow lands you control.
cards.flavor:

—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.originalText:
Defender
Drift of the Dead's power and toughness are each equal to the number of snow lands you control.

cards.name: Dry Spell
cards.text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Wherever water is lacking, all things suffer."
—Autumn Willow
cards.originalText: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Dystopia
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a green or white permanent.

rulings.text: The permanent is chosen and sacrificed during resolution.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a white or green permanent.

cards.name: Ebon Praetor
cards.text:
First strike, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -2/-2 counter on Ebon Praetor.
Sacrifice a creature: Remove a -2/-2 counter from Ebon Praetor. If the sacrificed creature was a Thrull, put a +1/+0 counter on Ebon Praetor. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
First strike, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -2/-2 counter on Ebon Praetor.
Sacrifice a creature: Remove a -2/-2 counter from Ebon Praetor. If the sacrificed creature was a Thrull, put a +1/+0 counter on Ebon Praetor. Play this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.

{B}, Pay 1 life: Return Foul Familiar to its owner's hand.

cards.originalText:
Foul Familiar can't block.
{B}, Pay 1 life: Return Foul Familiar to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Funeral March
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"This party is such fun—but it's a shame to mourn just one."
—Irini Sengir
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature leaves play, its controller sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Gangrenous Zombies
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Gangrenous Zombies: Gangrenous Zombies deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. If you control a snow Swamp, Gangrenous Zombies deals 2 damage to each creature and each player instead.

rulings.text: Whether it does 1 or 2 damage is checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Gangrenous Zombies: Gangrenous Zombies deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. If you control a snow Swamp, Gangrenous Zombies deals 2 damage to each creature and each player instead.

cards.name: Grandmother Sengir
cards.text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Rarely have power and madness been so delightfully wed as they have in our dear grandmother."
—Baron Sengir
cards.originalText: {1}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Icequake
cards.text: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, Icequake deals 1 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor:
"When the earth shakes, and their animals are swallowed up by the ground, perhaps they will think twice before attacking again."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

rulings.text: Checks only on resolution to see if the land has the supertype snow; it's not part of the targeting condition.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, Icequake deals 1 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Ihsan's Shade
cards.text: Protection from white
cards.flavor:
"Ihsan, the weak. Ihsan, the fallen. Ihsan, the betrayer. He has brought shame to the Serra paladins where none existed before. May his suffering equal his betrayal."
—Baris, Serra inquisitor
cards.originalText: Protection from white

cards.name: Imperial Seal
cards.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: "If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Infernal Darkness
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay {B} and 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces {B} instead of any other type.
cards.flavor:
"I thought the day had brought enough horrors for our ragged band, but the night was far worse."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

rulings.text: This effect changes the type of mana produced, but not the amount. For example, if a land that's tapped for mana would add {W}{W} to its controller's mana pool, it adds {B}{B} to that player's mana pool instead.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay {B} and 1 life.
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces {B} instead of any other type.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Dead
cards.text:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.
cards.flavor:
"They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

rulings.text: The sacrifice is a triggered ability and not a cost.
When Kjeldoran Dead's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, if you don't control any other creatures, you must sacrifice Kjeldoran Dead itself.

cards.originalText:
When Kjeldoran Dead comes into play, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.

cards.name: Knight of Stromgald
cards.text:
Protection from white
{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Kjeldorans should rule supreme, and to the rest, death!"
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald
cards.originalText:
Protection from white
{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Krovikan Fetish
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Krovikan Fetish enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Some Krovikans find strength in the ears and eyes of their victims and wear such fetishes into battle.

rulings.text: You do not get a card if the target becomes illegal and Krovikan Fetish doesn't resolve. This is because it never successfully enters the battlefield.
If it is moved to a new creature by something that moves Auras, the controller of the Fetish does not get to draw another card.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Krovikan Fetish comes into play, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

cards.name: Krovikan Horror
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if Krovikan Horror is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may return Krovikan Horror to your hand.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Krovikan Horror deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
At end of turn, if Krovikan Horror is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may return Krovikan Horror to your hand.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Krovikan Horror deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Krovikan Vampire
cards.text: At the beginning of each end step, if a creature dealt damage by Krovikan Vampire this turn died, put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Sacrifice it when you lose control of Krovikan Vampire.

rulings.text: At the beginning of each end step, the game checks all creatures that died that turn to see if Krovikan Vampire had dealt damage to them during the turn. It doesn't matter whether the damage was combat damage, and it doesn't matter whether the damage was what caused the creatures to die.

If a creature Krovikan Vampire dealt damage to dies, then leaves the graveyard by some means, the game loses track of it. Krovikan Vampire's ability won't be able to return it to the battlefield, even if it's put back into the graveyard before the end step.

Whoever controls Krovikan Vampire when the ability triggers will return the applicable cards to the battlefield under their control. It doesn't matter who controlled it at the time the damage was dealt.

If Krovikan Vampire isn't on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step, its ability won't trigger. No cards will be returned to the battlefield, even if Krovikan Vampire dealt damage to some creatures that died that turn.

If a creature that Krovikan Vampire dealt damage to that turn dies in response to the triggered ability, that creature card will be put onto the battlefield. Note that an appropriate creature must have died prior to the beginning of the end step in order for the ability to trigger in the first place.

cards.originalText: At end of turn, if a creature dealt damage by Krovikan Vampire this turn was put into a graveyard, put that card into play under your control. Sacrifice it when you lose control of Krovikan Vampire.

cards.name: Lim-Dûl's High Guard
cards.text:
First strike
{1}{B}: Regenerate Lim-Dûl's High Guard.
cards.flavor:
"The guard will forever stand ready. For them, death is merely an inconvenience, not an ending."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn
cards.originalText:
First strike
{1}{B}: Regenerate Lim-Dûl's High Guard.

cards.name: Minion of Leshrac
cards.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Leshrac deals 5 damage to you unless you sacrifice a creature other than Minion of Leshrac. If Minion of Leshrac deals damage to you this way, tap it.
{T}: Destroy target creature or land.

rulings.text: If you don't sacrifice a creature at the beginning of your upkeep (either by choice or because you can't), but you somehow prevent all the damage Minion of Leshrac would deal to you, then you don't tap Minion of Leshrac.
Minion of Leshrac can't target itself with its activated ability because it has protection from black.

cards.originalText:
Protection from black
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Leshrac deals 5 damage to you unless you sacrifice a creature other than Minion of Leshrac. If Minion of Leshrac deals damage to you this way, tap it.
{T}: Destroy target creature or land.

cards.name: Misinformation
cards.text: Put up to three target cards from an opponent's graveyard on top of their library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

rulings.text: You target the cards, but not the opponent.
You don't need to show the opponent what order you put the cards on top of their library.

cards.originalText: Put up to three target cards from an opponent's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order.

cards.name: Necrite
cards.text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counterinsurgency.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Necropotence
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

rulings.text: If a discarded card isn't put into your graveyard (due to an effect such as that of Obstinate Baloth) or leaves your graveyard (perhaps because another effect returned it to your hand), it won't be exiled.
If you discard a card with madness and wish to cast it, Necropotence's ability won't exile that card. If you don't wish to cast it, you choose whether it ends up exiled or in your graveyard.

Necropotence's last ability creates a delayed triggered ability that will put the exiled card into your hand. That ability still triggers even if Necropotence is removed from the battlefield before your end step.

cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, remove that card in your graveyard from the game.
Pay 1 life: Remove the top card of your library from the game face down. Put that card into your hand at the end of your turn.

cards.name: Phantasmal Fiend
cards.text:
{B}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn.

rulings.text: Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.

Effects that switch power and toughness are always applied last when determining a creature's power and toughness, even if other power/toughness-changing effects are created later in the turn. For example, if you activate Phantasmal Fiend's first ability, it will become 2/4. Then if you activate its second ability, it will become 4/2. Then if you activate its first ability again, it will become 3/3.
Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.originalText:
{B}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.name: Ritual of the Machine
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
cards.flavor:
"Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson heed the danger therein?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Ritual of the Machine, sacrifice a creature.
Gain control of target nonblack, nonartifact creature.

cards.name: Songs of the Damned
cards.text: Add {B} for each creature card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Not wind, but the breath of the dead.
cards.originalText: Add {B} to your mana pool for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Soul Exchange
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature you control.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +2/+2 counter on that creature if the exiled creature was a Thrull.

rulings.text: Putting a counter on the creature put onto the battlefield is not a targeted effect and so Protection from Black will not prevent it.
You exile exactly one creature. You can't exile more than one in an attempt to get a larger effect.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Soul Exchange, remove a creature you control from the game.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. Put a +2/+2 counter on that creature if the removed creature was a Thrull.

cards.name: Soul Kiss
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{B}, Pay 1 life: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
{B}, Pay 1 life: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Play this ability no more than three times each turn.

cards.name: Stromgald Cabal
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
cards.flavor:
"Kjeldor must be supreme at any cost."
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.

cards.name: Withering Wisps
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Withering Wisps.
{B}: Withering Wisps deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability no more times each turn than the number of snow Swamps you control.

rulings.text: Withering Wisps's triggered ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless there are no creatures on the battlefield when a turn's end step begins, and (2) the ability will do nothing if there are any creatures on the battlefield by the time the ability resolves.

If all creatures leave the battlefield during a turn's End step (after any "at the beginning of the end step" triggers would have triggered that turn), Withering Wisps will remain on the battlefield because the trigger condition has already passed.
The number of snow Swamps you control and the number of times Withering Wisps's ability has been activated so far that turn are checked each time you attempt to activate the ability.

cards.originalText:
At end of turn, if no creatures are in play, sacrifice Withering Wisps.
{B}: Withering Wisps deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Play this ability no more times each turn than the number of snow Swamps you control.

cards.name: Ambush Party
cards.text: First strike, haste
cards.flavor:
"Fair fight? I'll take survival over chivalry any day!"
—Tor Wauki, Bandit King
cards.originalText: First strike, haste

cards.name: Anarchy
cards.text: Destroy all white permanents.
cards.flavor:
"The shaman waved the staff, and the land itself went mad."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: Destroy all white permanents.

cards.name: An-Zerrin Ruins
cards.text:
As An-Zerrin Ruins enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"The An-Zerrins have served me well, ever since I first killed them."
—Baron Sengir
cards.originalText:
As An-Zerrin Ruins comes into play, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Balduvian Hydra
cards.text:
Balduvian Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+0 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+0 counter from Balduvian Hydra: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Balduvian Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+0 counter on Balduvian Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.originalText:
Balduvian Hydra comes into play with X +1/+0 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+0 counter from Balduvian Hydra: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Balduvian Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+0 counter on Balduvian Hydra. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Brassclaw Orcs
cards.text: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor:
"A whole skin is worth a thousand victories."
—Orcish veteran of the Battle of Montford
cards.originalText: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

cards.name: Brimstone Dragon
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.originalText: Flying, haste

cards.name: Burnout
cards.text:
Counter target instant spell if it's blue.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"GOTCHA!"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: You may target any instant spell with Burnout. If it's blue at the time Burnout resolves, that spell will be countered and you'll draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep. If it's not blue at the time Burnout resolves, that spell won't be countered, but you'll still draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.originalText:
Counter target instant spell if it's blue.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Conquer
cards.text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
cards.flavor:
"Why do we trade with those despicable elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald
cards.originalText:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.

cards.name: Death Spark
cards.text:
Death Spark deals 1 damage to any target.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Death Spark is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may pay {1}. If you do, return Death Spark to your hand.

rulings.text: A card is "directly above" another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later and there are no cards in between the two.
Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.
If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.

The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it's put into its owner's graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.

Say you're the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that's attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma's Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they're put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it's put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.

cards.originalText:
Death Spark deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Death Spark is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may pay {1}. If you do, return Death Spark to your hand.

cards.name: Errantry
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.
cards.flavor:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

rulings.text: "Can only attack alone" means the enchanted creature can't be declared as an attacker during the declare attackers step unless no other creatures are declared as attackers at that time (either by you or your Two-Headed Giant teammate).
If the enchanted creature attacks alone, then a spell or ability causes another creature to be put onto the battlefield attacking, that's fine.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature 
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.

cards.name: Fire Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Fire Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield, Fire Dragon will have to target itself. The ability is mandatory.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Fire Dragon comes into play, it deals damage equal to the number of Mountains you control to target creature.

cards.name: Flame Spirit
cards.text: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain
cards.originalText: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Glacial Crevasses
cards.text: Sacrifice a snow Mountain: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"We were chasing Lim-Dûl when the ridge in front of us suddenly crumbled. I can't believe it was mere coincidence."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a snow Mountain: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Goblin Ski Patrol
cards.text: {1}{R}: Goblin Ski Patrol gets +2/+0 and gains flying. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only once and only if you control a snow Mountain.
cards.flavor:
"AIIIEEEE!"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

rulings.text: Goblin Ski Patrol's ability may be activated only once in the entire game. If its ability is activated and then it changes controllers, its ability may not be activated again, and its new controller will still have to sacrifice it at the beginning of the End step.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Goblin Ski Patrol gets +2/+0 and gains flying. Its controller sacrifices it at end of turn. Play this ability only once and only if you control a snow Mountain.

cards.name: Gorilla Shaman
cards.text: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target noncreature artifact with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor:
"Each generation teaches the next that artifice is the enemy of natural order."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order

rulings.text: A tip on how this math works: The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 0 is {0} + {0} + {1} = {1}. The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 1 is {1} + {1} + {1} = {3}. The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 2 is {2} + {2} + {1} = {5}. And so on.

cards.originalText: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target noncreature artifact with converted mana cost X.

cards.name: Imperial Recruiter
cards.text: When Imperial Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
If a creature card has "*" in its power, the ability that defines its power works in all zones.

cards.originalText: When Imperial Recruiter comes into play, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Incinerate
cards.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

cards.originalText: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Ironclaw Orcs
cards.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan.
cards.originalText: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

cards.name: Karplusan Giant
cards.text: Tap an untapped snow land you control: Karplusan Giant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped snow land you control: Karplusan Giant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lava Burst
cards.text: Lava Burst deals X damage to any target. If Lava Burst would deal damage to a creature, that damage can't be prevented or dealt instead to another permanent or player.
cards.flavor:
"Overkill? This isn't a game of Kick-the-Ouphe!"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: Prevention and redirection effects will have no effect on damage dealt by Lava Burst to a creature. However, they will work on damage that Lava Burst would deal to a player.
A creature dealt damage by Lava Burst may be regenerated.

cards.originalText: Lava Burst deals X damage to target creature or player. If Lava Burst would deal damage to a creature, that damage can't be prevented or dealt instead to another creature or player.

cards.name: Meteor Shower
cards.text: Meteor Shower deals X plus 1 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor:
"Eenie, meenie, minie, moe . . . oh, why not all of them?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: You can't choose to do fractional damage to a target.

A tip on how this math works: To deal a total of 1 damage, X is 0. The cost is {0} + {0} + {R} = {R}. To deal a total of 2 damage, X is 1. The cost is {1} + {1} + {R} = {2}{R}. To deal a total of 3 damage, X is 2. The cost is {2} + {2} + {R} = {4}{R}. And so on.
The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most X + 1. You divide the damage as you cast Meteor Shower, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

cards.originalText: Meteor Shower deals X plus 1 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Mudslide
cards.text:
Creatures without flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped creatures without flying they control and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

rulings.text: First the player chooses all the tapped creatures they would like to untap this way. Then the entire payment is made at once, then all of those creatures untap at the same time. If the entire payment can't be paid (because the player chose too many creatures, for example), none of it is paid and none of those creatures untap.

cards.originalText:
Creatures without flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped creatures without flying he or she controls and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

cards.name: Orc General
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph."
—Malga Phlegmtooth
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Orcish Cannoneers
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain
cards.originalText: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Orcish Captain
cards.text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: There's a chance to win every battle.

rulings.text: You choose the target when you activate the ability. You don't flip a coin until the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Orcish Conscripts
cards.text:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.
cards.originalText:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.

cards.name: Orcish Farmer
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, the farmers keep our soldiers fed. But why do they have to make every battlefield a pigpen?"
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

rulings.text: This ability changes the targeted land's land types. It doesn't affect its name, its supertypes (such as whether or not it's legendary, snow, or basic), or its other types (if it's also a creature, for example). The ability will cause the land to lose all of its printed abilities and gain the ability "{T}: Add {B}."

cards.originalText: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Orcish Lumberjack
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G}.
cards.flavor:
"How did I ever let myself get talked into this project?"
—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Orcish Squatters
cards.text: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters assigns no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: The ability triggers on the declaration of blockers if no blockers are declared for it.
If you lose control of Orcish Squatters before its ability resolves, you won't gain control of the targeted land at all.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Orcish Veteran
cards.text:
Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater.
{R}: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Unsuccessful in their early battle for Montford, the orcs quickly tempered their bloodlust with cowardice.
cards.originalText:
Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater.
{R}: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.
